what: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals
title: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals
text: goal Ontario Board Tools (obt)) provide data professionals Ontario school boards (elsewhere) tools assist data cleaning analyses commonly used data sets. include: - Elementary Secondary Report Card - EQAO

title: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals
text: can install development version obt GitHub :

what: Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels
title: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals
text: functions takes vector report card marks re-codes Ontario achievement levels.
code: library(obt) library(dplyr) df <- ele_rc  df |>   select (id, reading) |>    mutate (reading_level = obt_recode_rc_to_levels(reading)) #> # A tibble: 2,500 x 3 #>        id reading reading_level #>     <int> <chr>   <chr>         #>  1 310535 R       NE1           #>  2 324271 R       NE1           #>  3 394022 52      Level 1       #>  4 482099 A-      Level 4       #>  5 274236 D       Level 1       #>  6 271998 B-      Level 3       #>  7 424555 C+      Level 2       #>  8 314324 B-      Level 3       #>  9 281326 R       NE1           #> 10 318039 B-      Level 3       #> # ... with 2,490 more rows #> # i Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

title: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals
text: function provides summary table counts percentages either single variable, grouped variable. table can used directly ggplot2 visualisations.
code: library(obt)  df <- ele_rc  df |>    obt_summary_table(school) #> # A tibble: 5 x 3 #>   school                            n  perc #>   <chr>                         <int> <dbl> #> 1 Degrassi Community School       500   0.2 #> 2 Shelbyville Elementary School   500   0.2 #> 3 Southpark Elementary School     500   0.2 #> 4 Springfield Elementary School   500   0.2 #> 5 Watkins Middle School           500   0.2

title: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals
code: library(obt)  df <- ele_rc  df |>    obt_summary_table(school, grade) #> # A tibble: 41 x 4 #> # Groups:   school [5] #>    school                        grade     n  perc #>    <chr>                         <chr> <int> <dbl> #>  1 Degrassi Community School     1        54 0.108 #>  2 Degrassi Community School     2        65 0.13  #>  3 Degrassi Community School     3        56 0.112 #>  4 Degrassi Community School     4        59 0.118 #>  5 Degrassi Community School     5        65 0.13  #>  6 Degrassi Community School     6        54 0.108 #>  7 Degrassi Community School     7        65 0.13  #>  8 Degrassi Community School     8        82 0.164 #>  9 Shelbyville Elementary School 1        71 0.142 #> 10 Shelbyville Elementary School 2        59 0.118 #> # ... with 31 more rows #> # i Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

text: dataframe 2500 rows 16 variables id Unique student identifier school School student enrolled grade Grade student responsibility Learning Skill - Responsibility initiative Learning Skill - Initiative independent_work Learning Skill - Independent Work organization Learning Skill - Organization collaboration Learning Skill - Collaboration self_regulation Learning Skill - Self Regulation reading Final Mark - Reading writing Final Mark - Writing mathematics Final Mark - Mathematics science_and_technology Final Mark - Science Technology social_studies Final Mark - Social Studies history Final Mark - History geography Final Mark - Geography

what: obt: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals — obt-package
title: obt: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals — obt-package
text: obt (Ontario Board Tools) collection functions data professionals working Ontario school boards. functions designed assist working common data sets across province, Report Card, EQAO, OUAC, OCAS others.

title: obt: Functions for Ontario School Board data professionals — obt-package
text: Maintainer: Rousell Greg grousell@gmail.com

text: x Vector report card marks. Can either alpha (C+, B-, ) numeric (88, 63, 79)

what: Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
title: Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
text: function takes report card marks, alpha (+, B, C-, etc.) numeric (68, 72, 86, etc.) converts achievement levels used Ontario school boards

title: Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
text: x Vector report card marks. Can either alpha (C+, B-, ) numeric (88, 63, 79)

title: Recode Report Card Marks to Achievement Levels — obt_recode_rc_to_levels
text: Character vector achievement levels (NE1, Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, Level 4)

title: Summary Table — obt_summary_table
text: Given dataframe tibble, returns tibble counts percentages group. Can single group, group 2 can nested within group 1

title: Summary Table — obt_summary_table
Summary Table — obt_summary_table
text: df Dataframe tibble group_1 First grouping variable group_2 Second grouping variable (optional)

title: Summary Table — obt_summary_table
text: tibble counts percentages group

title: Summary Table — obt_summary_table
